metadata.title: CVE-2018-1046 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
pdns before version 4.1.2 is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in dnsreplay.In the dnsreplay tool provided with PowerDNS Authoritative, replaying aspecially crafted PCAP file can trigger a stack-based buffer overflow,leading to a crash and potentially arbitrary code execution. This bufferoverflow only occurs when the -ecs-stamp option of dnsreplay is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1046` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-lua2 - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.2.1
pdns-ixfrdist - 4.2.1
pdns-server - 4.2.1
pdns-tools - 4.2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.1').
